page.title: 11SUTTON BONINGTON BRICKWORKS
page.content: The people of{Hathernware}were very worried, 3 years ago they could not get enough work.They would have had to close down which would have meant more people unemployed.{Hathernware}is not worried any more because they now repair{stonework}and make replacements for protected buildings. They are sending{bricks}and{tiles}all over the world and have taken on apprentices to learn the trade. They buy{bricks}and {clay}from Stoke, which they crush up into{grog}and they mix it with water to make{slip,}then it all goes through a machine to make{clay bricks.}It is dried at 60-65 degrees F. They have 3 large gas kilns. They are working on many famous buildings all over {England.
